issue.title: Prevent literal string from containing numeric-string

repository.name: psalm
repository.description: A PHP static analysis tool for finding errors and security vulnerabilities in PHP applications

issue.body:
When experimenting with a potential fix for #3438 I've discovered the inconsistency between handling of conditional types with numeric literal strings:

https://psalm.dev/r/5abaad52a8

I would not expect the above to produce any issues.

body:
Once the linked ticket is fixed, it'll be possible to express `bcdiv` type as:
```php
/**
 * @psalm-pure
 *
 * @template T of numeric-string
 * @param numeric-string $left_operand
 * @param T $right_operand
 * @return (T is "0" ? null : numeric-string)
 */
function bcdiv(string $left_operand, string $right_operand, int $scale = 0): ?string {}
```

I found these snippets:
<details>
<summary>https://psalm.dev/r/80f91a4817</summary>

```php
<?php

/**
 * @psalm-pure
 *
 * @param numeric-string $left_operand
 * @param numeric-string $right_operand
 * @return ($right_operand is "0" ? null : numeric-string)
 */
function bcdiv2(string $left_operand, string $right_operand, int $scale = 0): ?string {}

/**
 * @psalm-trace $test1
 */
$test1 = bcdiv2('5', '0');
/**
 * @psalm-trace $test2
 */
$test2 = bcdiv2('5', '1');
```

```
Psalm output (using commit f5a0622):

INFO: UnusedParam - 10:24 - Param $left_operand is never referenced in this method

INFO: UnusedParam - 10:46 - Param $right_operand is never referenced in this method

INFO: UnusedParam - 10:66 - Param $scale is never referenced in this method

INFO: Trace - 15:1 - $test1: null

INFO: Trace - 19:1 - $test2: null|numeric-string

INFO: UnusedVariable - 15:1 - Variable $test1 is never referenced

INFO: UnusedVariable - 19:1 - Variable $test2 is never referenced
```
</details>

> you should even be able to remove the @template in this case

~No, it doesn't seem to work with variables: https://psalm.dev/r/11f0b87b16~

Edit: my bad, it does: https://psalm.dev/r/705ad41f5a

I found these snippets:
<details>
<summary>https://psalm.dev/r/11f0b87b16</summary>

```php
<?php

/**
 * @psalm-pure
 *
 * @param int $right_operand
 * @return ($right_operand is 0 ? null : numeric-string)
 */
function bcdiv2 (int $_op): ?string { return null;}
```

```
Psalm output (using commit f5a0622):

ERROR: InvalidDocblock - 9:1 - Unrecognized template '$right_operand' in docblock for bcdiv2
```
</details>

<details>
<summary>https://psalm.dev/r/705ad41f5a</summary>

```php
<?php

/**
 * @psalm-pure
 *
 * @param int $_op
 * @return ($_op is 0 ? null : numeric-string)
 */
function bcdiv2 (int $_op): ?string { return null;}

function f(): string {
    return bcdiv2(0);
}

function ff(): string {
    return bcdiv2(1);
}
```

```
Psalm output (using commit f5a0622):

ERROR: NullableReturnStatement - 12:12 - The declared return type 'string' for f is not nullable, but the function returns 'null'

ERROR: InvalidNullableReturnType - 11:15 - The declared return type 'string' for f is not nullable, but 'null' contains null
```
</details>

> > you should even be able to remove the @template in this case
> 
> No, it doesn't seem to work with variables: https://psalm.dev/r/11f0b87b16

https://psalm.dev/r/47f571287c
I fixed the variable name :)

I found these snippets:
<details>
<summary>https://psalm.dev/r/11f0b87b16</summary>

```php
<?php

/**
 * @psalm-pure
 *
 * @param int $right_operand
 * @return ($right_operand is 0 ? null : numeric-string)
 */
function bcdiv2 (int $_op): ?string { return null;}
```

```
Psalm output (using commit f5a0622):

ERROR: InvalidDocblock - 9:1 - Unrecognized template '$right_operand' in docblock for bcdiv2
```
</details>

<details>
<summary>https://psalm.dev/r/47f571287c</summary>

```php
<?php

/**
 * @psalm-pure
 *
 * @param int $_op
 * @return ($_op is 0 ? null : numeric-string)
 */
function bcdiv2 (int $_op): ?string { return null;}
```

```
Psalm output (using commit f5a0622):

No issues!
```
</details>

issue.title: Fix #3438

repository.name: psalm
repository.description: A PHP static analysis tool for finding errors and security vulnerabilities in PHP applications

issue.body:
This PR should fix #3438.

EDIT: I hesitated to create a test but I couldn't find any Tester for bc* functions, or any Tester where this could fit. Please tell me if needed, I'll add this kind of test: https://psalm.dev/r/41cf16dc2d
